required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase III Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of ENIA11 in Combination With Methotrexate Versus Methotrexate Alone in Patients With RA
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel-Group, Multicentre, Phase III Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of ENIA11 in Combination With Methotrexate Versus Methotrexate Alone in Patients With Rheumatoid Arthritis

brief_summary.textblock: A Prospective, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel-Group, Multicentre, Phase III Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of ENIA11 in Combination with Methotrexate versus Methotrexate Alone in Patients with Rheumatoid Arthritis

detailed_description.textblock:
The objectives of the study are to evaluate the efficacy and safety of ENIA11 in combination with methotrexate versus methotrexate alone in patients with rheumatoid arthritis.
This is a multi-center, double-blind, randomized, parallel-group, placebo-controlled study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of ENIA11 in combination with methotrexate versus methotrexate alone in patients with rheumatoid arthritis.
Subject participation duration: A total of 28 weeks, including: 2 weeks of screening, 24 weeks of treatment and 2 weeks of follow-up

primary_outcome.measure: ACR20 responder at last treatment visit
primary_outcome.description: The primary efficacy endpoint is defined as ACR20 responder at last treatment visit (Week 24).
